snippet: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, offered a notable silence on a corruption case involving the speaker of the New York Assembly after his public remarks became part of it.
abstract: Federal prosecutor Preet Bharara refrains, during speech at law school about public corruption, form making public remarks on case against former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver; lawyers for Silver had asked judge to dismiss indictment against him because of Bharara's earlier public comments that they assert have tainted case.
lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, offered a notable silence on a corruption case involving the speaker of the New York Assembly after his public remarks became part of it.

headline.main: U.S. Attorney Keeps Talking, but Leaves Out Sheldon Silver
headline.print_headline: U.S. Attorney Keeps Talking, but Leaves Out Sheldon Silver
